text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion specifically asks the model to analyze whether the principle of unreasonable non-disclosure under Schedule 3, paragraph 2(b) of the Land Registration Act 2002 applies, focusing on whether the occupier failed to disclose their interest when they reasonably could have been expected to do so. The candidate answer discusses Adverse Possession and Tolerated Trespasser status but completely fails to mention or analyze the concept of 'unreasonable non-disclosure' in relation to the potential buyer's inquiry (the text message) and the protection afforded by actual occupation under property law.", "criterion_id": "ff667083-8301-4791-98b8-3c393f9d217a"}
